cz.ive.evaltree
Class ExprDAG<ROOTTYPE extends ValueHolderImpl>

java.lang.Object
  cz.ive.evaltree.ExprDAG<ROOTTYPE>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Updateable, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
RelaxedExprDAG, StrictExprDAG
public abstract class ExprDAG<ROOTTYPE extends ValueHolderImpl>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Updateable, java.io.Serializable

Used to store set of expressions. (DAG = directed acyclic graph) If there are some equivalent subexpressions they are evaluated only once. Similar to RETE structure. Changes are evaluated by calling update method.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

queue

protected java.util.Queue<QueueHook> queue
Queue shared by all Expr nodes in DAG used to spread changes

equalCandidates

private ContentEqualSet equalCandidates
Storage for candidates for equal subexpressions. Used during merging tree into DAG. It is initially filled by the leaves. During the merge all parents of nodes that are equal to some node from the new expression are added.

leaves

private java.util.Set<Expr<? extends ValueHolderImpl,? extends ValueHolderImpl>> leaves
DAG leaves

roots

private java.util.HashMap<Expr<ROOTTYPE extends ValueHolderImpl,? extends ValueHolderImpl>,java.lang.Integer> roots
DAG roots

dagId

private final int dagId
identifier of DAG instance

tmp

private java.util.LinkedList<Expr> tmp
used by removeExpression to store childs to be removed (BFS of the tree)

Constructor Detail

ExprDAG

public ExprDAG()
Creates a new instance of ExprDAG. This doesn't include creation of queue. That's why this class is abstract.

Method Detail

insertExpression

public Expr<ROOTTYPE,? extends ValueHolderImpl> insertExpression(Expr<ROOTTYPE,? extends ValueHolderImpl> e)
Insert new expression into DAG. You wont be able to get it back from DAG The expression must be already instantiated. It returns the given expression merged with the content of the DAG. The returned reference can be the same as passed or reference to another expression already inserted into the DAG. Never keep the reference you passed into this function. Use only the returned version.

Parameters:
e - expression to be inserted
Returns:
the DAG version of given expression

insertTree

private Expr<? extends ValueHolderImpl,? extends ValueHolderImpl> insertTree(Expr<? extends ValueHolderImpl,? extends ValueHolderImpl> newExpr)
Postfix DFS pass of the tree to be inserted. Node's queue used to store change notifications is changed. Function is recursively called to all childs If node equals to any member of equalCandidates, equal subexpression was found.In that case node's parent's method remapChild is called and parent of node from equalCandidates is inserted into equalCandidates. equalCandidates is filled by DAG leaves (in insertExpression method) at first

Parameters:
newExpr - Expr to be inserted
Returns:
the expression from the DAG that is equivalent to the newExpr. It may be the same expresion, but not necessary

removeExpression

public void removeExpression(Expr expr)
Remove expression from DAG. Destroys removed expression but there could be common subexpressions that remains in the dag. Anyway do not keep the reference to the removed expression. Breath first traversal of DAG from given root. Removes only nodes, that hasn't parent any more

Parameters:
expr - expression to be removed

update

public void update()
Evaluate all changes in DAG. Only changing values of leaves doesnt effect values of roots untill you call this function

Specified by:
update in interface Updateable

needUpdate

public boolean needUpdate()
Returns true if there is some parg of the DAG that needs to be reevaluated

Specified by:
needUpdate in interface Updateable
Returns:
true if there is some waiting event in the queue of change notifications.

changeSensors

public void changeSensors(java.util.List<Sensor> sensors)
Change the sensors of all expressions stored in the DAG. It just passes the given list to all roots.

Parameters:
sensors - sensors that are passed to the manager of senses query that could appear somewhere in the DAG

dump

public void dump(java.io.File f)
Write current DAG into *.dot file. Dot file is used to represent graphs and can be processed by GraphViz tool (http://www.graphviz.org).

Parameters:
f - file the DAG is written to
